content: hey all
@Eric Huss pinged me a couple months ago about updating my "Fetching cargo registry tokens from external processes" RFC
unfortunately I didn't have the time to followup on that yet, and honestly I don't think I'll be able to in the future
(also because I found a workaround that kinda works for my personal tooling without needing the rfc...)
what is y'all's preferred outcome for it?
the rfc btw: https://github.com/rust-lang/rfcs/pull/2730
I can take it over if you want.
@Eric Huss that'd be great, how would you prefer to do that?

I would kinda like write permissions on the RFC repo. I've noticed several situations where nobody will update or merge PRs, and I would like to assist with that (particularly for T-cargo PRs). With write permissions, I think I should be able to push to your branch.
Otherwise, I guess I would need to open a new PR?
hmm, I'm not entirely sure what the policy on granting write access to the rfcs repo is
Yea, I dunno either, I've never seen it written down. I think there is a rfc pushers GitHub group, though I dunno how it is managed.
by looking at the membership it seems like "people asked"
which is... not great
let me ask in core
@Pietro Albini I think it's not quite as dire as "people asked", but I do think it's roughly "people who were willing to help and some member of a team wanted to let help", somewhat haphazardly.
Narrowing it to "people on a team" would probably be a good idea.
(We should evaluate the delta that would produce, and if there are people who actively help, that information should end up in the teams repo.)
@Eric Huss granted you write access

Yeah, so I want to use the nix build system to build cargo projects. For this I would need to call nix, instead of rustc. What I hope to archive is that nix can build rust software much faster, as it then can cache crates, instead of rebuilding everything everytime
(deleted)
@Pietro Albini I appear to have write access to the RFC repo, but I don't have the permissions to merge. It says the branch is protected, and I am not authorized to merge.
